content.description: A recent study reported that 1.5 percent of flights are canceled by major air carriers. Consider a simulation with 50 trials designed to estimate the number of canceled flights from a random sample of size 100, where the probability of success, a canceled flight, is 0.015.
content.question: Of the following dotplots, which best represents the possible results from the simulation described?

choices.label: The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 7. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. 0, 6 dots. 1, 6 dots. 2, 6 dots. 3, 7 dots. 4, 7 dots. 5, 6 dots. 6, 6 dots. 7, 6 dots.

The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 7. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. 0, 11 dots. 1, 17 dots. 2, 13 dots. 3, 6 dots. 4, 2 dots. 5, 1 dot. 6, 0 dots. 7, 0 dots.

The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 7. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. 0, 1 dot. 1, 3 dots. 2, 7 dots. 3, 14 dots. 4, 14 dots. 5, 7 dots. 6, 3 dots. 7, 1 dot.

The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 70, in increments of 10. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. 0, 1 dot. 10, 3 dots. 20, 7 dots. 30, 14 dots. 40, 14 dots. 50, 7 dots. 60, 3 dots. 70, 1 dot.

The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. The tick marks 0 through 60 each have 0 dots. 70, 3 dots. 80, 10 dots. 90, 20 dots. 100, 17 dots.

content.answer: The figure presents a dot plot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 7. The number of dots at each tick mark are as follows. 0, 11 dots. 1, 17 dots. 2, 13 dots. 3, 6 dots. 4, 2 dots. 5, 1 dot. 6, 0 dots. 7, 0 dots.
